passage_text: shear flow. Definitions: 1. a flow of a material in which parallel planes in the material are displaced in a direction parallel to each other. The definition information for shear flow is provided by Stedman's. You can search our medical dictionary here.

This equation will be used in this section to calculate both the shear flow and the average shearing stress in thin-walled members such as flanges of wide-flange beams (Fig. 2) and box beams or the walls of structural tubes. LECTURE 15.

The term shear flow is used in solid mechanics as well as in fluid dynamics. The expression shear flow is used to indicate: 1  a shear stress caused by torsion on a closed, thin-walled tube (in solid mechanics); 2  the flow induced by a force (in a fluid).

In solid mechanics, the shear flow q in a closed, thin-wall tube is defined as the internal shearing force V per unit of length of the perimeter around a thin section. Shear flow has the dimensions of force per unit of length.
